definitions.definition: To relocate periodically from one region to another, usually according to the seasons.
definitions.example: Twice a year the Minnesotans migrate from their state to the Gulf of Mexico.

definitions.definition: To change one's geographic pattern of habitation.
definitions.example: Many groups had migrated to western Europe from the plains of eastern Europe.

definitions.definition: To change habitations across a border; to move from one country or political region to another.
definitions.example: To escape persecution, they migrated to a neutral country.

definitions.definition: To move slowly towards, usually in groups.
definitions.example: Once the hosts started bickering in the kitchens, the guests began to migrate towards the living room.

definitions.definition: : To move computer code or files from one computer or network to another.
definitions.example: They had finished migrating all of the affected code to the production server by 2:00am, three hours later than expected.

definitions.definition: To induce customers to shift purchases from one set of a company's related products to another.
definitions.example: We were hoping to migrate the customers of the "C" series to the "E" series and the "E" customers to the "S" series.
